definition: The terms in this category are related to account in an IOTA network

address.definition: A public key that belongs to a seed and that has a balance of IOTA tokens on IOTA networks

IOTA token.definition: Unit of value that can be transferred over an IOTA network

security level.definition: An address generation parameter that affects the security of one-time signatures

seed.definition: Unique password that is used to generate addresses, private keys, and signatures

definition: The terms in this category are related to cryptography

Curl.definition: Hashing function, designed for the Internet of things, that uses the SHA-3 sponge-based construction

Kerl.definition: Ternary version of the Keccek-384 hashing function that takes a 48 byte input and produces a 243 trit output, using [two's complement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement)

definition: The terms in this category are related to IOTA networks

blowball.definition: A subgraph where a majority of tip transactions reference one central transaction

Coordinator.definition: A subgraph where a majority of tip transactions reference one central transaction

node.definition: A device that is part of an IOTA network and that has read and write access to the Tangle

subgraph.definition: Section of the Tangle that contains transactions between a milestone transaction and tip transactions

Tangle.definition: An immutable data structure that contains an up-to-date history of transactions, each of which references two others

definition: The terms in this category are related to transactions

bundle.definition: Group of transactions that rely on each other's validity

child.definition: Transaction that directly references two other transactions

confirmed.definition: State of a transaction when it's been approved by a milestone

depth.definition: Entry milestone that's used to start tip selection through a subgraph

future set.definition: Two or more transactions that reference the same transaction

proof of work.definition: Data that is calculated using trial and error to meet certain requirements

solid.definition: State of a transaction when an IOTA node has its entire history in its ledger

minimum weight magnitude.definition: A setting for proof of work that defines the number of trailing zeros that a transaction hash must have

milestone.definition: Transaction that's created by the Coordinator

parent.definition: Transaction that is directly referenced by a child transaction

pending.definition: State of a transaction when it's attached to the Tangle, but not yet confirmed

rebroadcast.definition: Send the same transaction to an IOTA node again

tail transaction.definition: The first transaction in a bundle

tip selection.definition: Process whereby an IOTA node selects two tip transactions from the Tangle
